definition: to get rid of the old to bring in the new (idiom); to innovate
broken/damaged/worn out/lousy/rotten/to break, split or cleave/to get rid of/to destroy/to break with/to defeat/to capture (a city etc)/to expose the truth of
to stand/to set up/to establish/to lay down/to draw up/at once/immediately
abbr. for Xinjiang 新疆[Xin1 jiang1] or Singapore 新加坡[Xin1 jia1 po1]/surname Xin

sentences.english: To "think outside the box" is to try new ways to solve a problem.
sentences.chinese: 破旧立新的意思就是要用新方法解决问题。

sentences.english: The key is knowing when to follow the rules and when to break them.
sentences.chinese: 关键是要知道何时该循规蹈矩，何时需破旧立新。

definition: to discard the old and introduce the new (idiom); to innovate
to get rid of the old to bring in the new (idiom); to innovate
to destroy the old and establish the new (idiom)/radical transformation
(idiom) to continue in the same old rut/diehard conservative attitudes
abreast of modern developments/to keep up with the times/progressive/timely
to cherish the outmoded and preserve the outworn (idiom); conservative/stickler for tradition
